q: of the obtuse and esoteric references department: Donald Rumsfeld 's adorable ''didn't know'' shenanigans reminded this columnist of the opening of ''The Hunter S. Thompson Sleep,'' when Carmen Sternwood falls backwards. Philip Marlowe says: I had to catch her or let her crack her head on the tessellated floor. The mainstream media does for Donald Rumsfeld what Marlowe did for Carmen by unquestioningly accepting his disingenuous explanations. ''Good boy, Rover!'' The previously mentioned letter sent to the New York Times

earned produces some unexpected results. A couple of months ago, when David Letterman introduced Bruce Willis on his show to promote the action-comedy movie Reds, the talk-show host declared in apparent amazement that Bruce Willis had earned more than$ 1.5-billion at the box office. But David Letterman 's researchers seriously low-balled Bruce Willis 's impact. Counting Bruce Willis 's credited roles in 49 movies, his total box office is in the$ 5.7-billion range.( All figures are from the movie sites, Box

She started to struggle,'' Debbie Wasserman Schultz told journalists aboard Air Force One as she accompanied Barack Obama back to Washington. It felt like we were watching a miracle. ''New York senator Kirsten Gillibrand said she and Debbie Wasserman Schultz were crying and when Gabrielle Giffords ' husband, Mark Kelly, a NASA astronaut, told his wife that if she could see them, she should give a thumbs up sign. ''Instead of giving us the thumbs up, she literally raises her whole arm, Kirsten Gillibrand said.Kelly has been ever present at his wife's side since the attack. for an executive who is transitioning out of the CEO role- and may even be unusual for sitting CEOs, said David Wise, senior principal at management consulting firm Hay Group. But given Eric Schmidt 's success, the board clearly wants to retain his guidance for the next four years. ''It's a signal to shareholders that he'll continue to steer the boat,'' Wise added. Eric Schmidt , 55, is being replaced as Google's CEO by co-founder Larry Page.

according to a blog post penned by the man himself. The decision came down to how best optimise Google's triumvirate of power( Eric Schmidt , Page and Sergey Brin ) to become a more adaptable enterprise. Larry, Sergey Brin and I have been talking for a long time about how best to simplify our management structure and speed up decision making- and over the holidays we decided now was the right moment to make some changes to the way we are structured, Eric Schmidt said. While Page takes the helm of CEO, Eric Schmidt will be executive chairman where he said he will focus on ''deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships, government outreach and technology

DETROIT-- Chrysler reported a$ 199 million net loss for the fourth quarter of 2010, but excluding interest on its government loans and other restructuring debts, it earned a$ 198 million operating profit. What Chrysler delivered last year, on both the product and financial fronts, surpassed many expectations, Chief Executive Sergio Marchionne said. ''However, our job is not yet done.
